Description: Body fragment of black-figured pottery open vase, krater (?); glazed fairly thin and matt on the interior, probably slipped on the exterior. Komast to left; the faint lines of his torso and much of his arms and legs remain; to the right, the remains of another figure. Incision for interior details.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'The fragment fits with none of the four fabrics - Corinthian, Attic, Clazomenian, or Chiot - in which komasts are important subjects. (For komasts in North Ionian black figure see BSA 60 [1965] pl.27 no.34; but the fabric of this vase is unslipped).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 56, no. 198 pl. 47)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.542)
